front.title: Security Requirements for a Light Weight Access Point Protocol

abstract.t: LWAPP defines the interactions of wireless lan infrastructurecomponents, including access points (APs) and access routers (ARs).The AR represents a centralized point of management control in suchinfrastructures, implying critical control signalling between APs andARs. Given the open nature of WLANs, a careful analysis of securitythreats is required, and appropriate security countermeasures must bedefined. This document provides a security analysis and makesrecommendations for securing LWAPP
